get.description: Retrieves published research notes that match a specified set of research note attribute criteria (author, department, security, issuer, industry sector, etc.)

parameters.description: A unique identifier for this request.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID

parameters.description: Timestamp assigned to this request at origin, in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Origin-Timestamp

parameters.description:
Specifies the filter criteria, please refer to ResearchNote message for valid criteria target field name
The supported syntax (for now): 
note.[target field]:[term] Eg: note.author:"user"
[term] Eg: Technology (Matches anything containing Technology anywhere). Multiple criteria can also be joined by AND and OR logic operator
Other supported logic operator includes ! means not equal, IN for a list of value terms, etc.
e.g. note.author:"user" AND (note.entities.asset_id:"123456789" OR note.entities.issuer:"*ABC*") , etc.
Valid field name could be referered in the ResearchNote message type
(-- aip.dev/beta-blocker: Further refactoring/change is needed when the search/filtering standards are finalized --)
(-- api-linter: core::0132::request-unknown-fields=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We really need this field because it is already being used in prod. --)
parameters.name: filterCriteria

parameters.description: Sorts the response with ascending or descending order based on specific field. Default as asc. e.g. "note.publish_time desc, note.author".
parameters.name: orderBy

parameters.description:
The maximum number of research notes to return. The service may
return fewer than this value. If unspecified, at most 10
note will be returned.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description:
A page token, received from a previous 'SearchResearchNotes' call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters provided to
'SearchResearchNotes' must match the call that provided the page
token.
parameters.name: pageToken

parameters.description:
Used to provide with facet search capabilities by simply specifiying the fields to be used as base
and by consequence, returned with an array for each of the specified fields and it's terms and
matches for each of the entries.
parameters.name: facetFields

parameters.description:
When the field list is provided, only retrieve specified fields.
(-- api-linter: core::0132::request-unknown-fields=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because field list is required for security reasons --).
parameters.name: fieldLists

Any.description:
`Any` contains an arbitrary serialized message along with a
URL that describes the type of the serialized message

@type.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized message.

permissionGroup.title:
permission group
(-- aip.dev/beta-blocker: refactor to use permission common resource when it's ready --)

- EXPIRING_PERMISSION_TIME_UNIT_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified
 - EXPIRING_PERMISSION_TIME_UNIT_DAYS: Days
 - EXPIRING_PERMISSION_TIME_UNIT_WEEKS: Weeks
 - EXPIRING_PERMISSION_TIME_UNIT_MONTHS: Months
 - EXPIRING_PERMISSION_TIME_UNIT_FOREVER: Forever

v1InvestmentStewardshipAssessment.description:
- INVESTMENT_STEWARDSHIP_ASSESSMENT_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified or N/A
 - INVESTMENT_STEWARDSHIP_ASSESSMENT_COMPLETELY_SATISFIED: Completely satisfied
 - INVESTMENT_STEWARDSHIP_ASSESSMENT_MOSTLY_SATISFIED: Mostly satisfied
 - INVESTMENT_STEWARDSHIP_ASSESSMENT_NEUTRAL: Neither satisfied nor unsatisfied
 - INVESTMENT_STEWARDSHIP_ASSESSMENT_MOSTLY_UNSATISFIED: Mostly unsatisfied
 - INVESTMENT_STEWARDSHIP_ASSESSMENT_COMPLETELY_UNSATISFIED: Not at all satisfied
v1InvestmentStewardshipAssessment.title: Investment stewardship assessment enums

fixedKeywords.title:
Fixed keywords, which is specific to investment stewardship type of note that provides
a fixed list of keyword tags for certain common topic/tags used in investment stewardship

clientNote.title:
In addition to the general note content, the investment stewardship note provides one additional 
note field, Client Note, for user to record client's feedback

v1InvestmentStewardshipEngagement.description:
- INVESTMENT_STEWARDSHIP_ENGAGEMENT_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified
 - INVESTMENT_STEWARDSHIP_ENGAGEMENT_GENERAL_THEMATIC: General/Thematic
 - INVESTMENT_STEWARDSHIP_ENGAGEMENT_PREVOTE_CLARIFICATION: Pre-Vote Clarification
 - INVESTMENT_STEWARDSHIP_ENGAGEMENT_POSTVOTE_RATIONALE_EXPLANATION: Post-Vote Rationale Explanation

 - INVESTMENT_STEWARDSHIP_TOPIC_BOARD_COMPOSITION: Board Composition & Effectiveness

 - INVESTMENT_STEWARDSHIP_TOPIC_BUSINESS_OVERSIGHT: Business Oversight/Risk Management
 - INVESTMENT_STEWARDSHIP_TOPIC_CORPORATE_STRATEGY: Corporate Strategy
 - INVESTMENT_STEWARDSHIP_TOPIC_REMUNERATION: Remuneration
 - INVESTMENT_STEWARDSHIP_TOPIC_HUMAN_CAPITAL_MANAGEMENT: Human Capital Management
 - INVESTMENT_STEWARDSHIP_TOPIC_SOCIAL_RISKS_OPPORTUNITIES: Social Risks and Opportunities
 - INVESTMENT_STEWARDSHIP_TOPIC_CLIMATE_RISK_MANAGEMENT: Climate Risk Management
 - INVESTMENT_STEWARDSHIP_TOPIC_OPERATIONAL_SUSTAINABILITY: Operational Sustainability
 - INVESTMENT_STEWARDSHIP_TOPIC_ENVIRONMENT_IMPACT_MANAGEMENT: Environmental Impact Management
v1InvestmentStewardshipTopic.title: Invesetment stewardship topic enums

v1NoteState.description:
- NOTE_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: The NoteStatus has not been specified
 - NOTE_STATE_REGULAR: The note is a regular note
 - NOTE_STATE_DRAFT: The note is a draft note
 - NOTE_STATE_DELETED: The note is deleted
 - NOTE_STATE_INVALID: The note is auto deleted and marked as invalid
that deleted from Aladdin Research team either from index program or bulk load failure
v1NoteState.title: NoteState specifies the type of research note state (regular, draft, deleted)

v1PublishPreference.description: The user's Research Note publish preferences.

defaultNoteCategory.title: The user's saved default research note category

defaultPermissionGroups.title: The user's saved default research note permission group

canPublishNote.title: Flag to determine if user has the perms to publish new research notes

id.description:
ID describes the computer or human assigned resource identifier.
The research note id.

author.description: The author of the research note.

creator.description: The creator of the research note.

subject.description: The subject (title) of the research note.

selectedPermissionGroups.title:
The selected permission groups.
(-- aip.dev/beta-blocker: refactor to use permission common resource when it's ready --)

entities.title: The entities (e.g. securities, issuers, etc.) are associated with this research note

v1SearchPreference.description: The user's Research Note search preferences.

searchFilters.title: Map to hold user's search filters

searchParameters.title: Map to hold user's search parameters (internal and exposure lookback periods, etc.)

v1SearchResearchNotesResponse.title:
The response message for ResearchAPI.ListResearchs.

 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is irrelevant at this context --)
